intro: Anisomeris catharinae, commonly known as the Catrina's anisomeris, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves with a fuzzy texture, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in late spring to early summer. Anisomeris catharinae is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
